key_points: Tom Brady showcased his seven Super Bowl rings, celebrating his win with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers for Super Bowl LV.
He used a 'How it started vs How it's going' meme, comparing his early days with the Patriots to now.
Brady won six Super Bowls with the New England Patriots over 19 years before joining the Buccaneers in 2020.
His first championship win with the Buccaneers came after defeating the Kansas City Chiefs 31-9 in February.
The latest Super Bowl ring features 319 diamonds, representing the final score, and has unique elements like a removable top with "HISTORIC" etched on it.
Brady's wife, Gisele BÃ¼ndchen, questioned what more he had to prove after the recent Super Bowl win.
On The Late Late Show, Brady expressed his desire to prove to himself he can still play at age 44.
He aims to continue playing professionally until at least 45 and values the sacrifices his family has made for his career.
Brady emphasizes playing out of love for the game and competition, rejecting arbitrary retirement timelines.
He is currently on a two-year contract and is open about seeing what the future holds beyond that.
